A Bit About Us

We are a leading producer, packager and distributor of high quality, great tasting, health-focused beverages. We continue to experience significant growth and are looking for a Quality Champion!



Why join us?


We value our people as much we value our products. When you put your people first, you can't lose. We strive to provide our employees with a great work environment, we offer industry leading pay & benefits. The future is bright here, come join us on this amazing journey!

Job Details

Responsibilities

  • Production Operations
  • Supervise a team of production personnel, providing clear direction, coaching, and ensuring adherence to safety protocols and Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs).
  • Monitor production processes to identify and address any potential issues or bottlenecks, maintaining a high sense of urgency to minimize disruptions.
  • Maintain KPIs, manage line/area efficiencies and production downtime
  • Analyze data to determine appropriate corrective action response.
  • Ensure efficient use of equipment and labor to meet production targets and deadlines.
  • Manages overall packaging and product quality to ensure required standards and specifications are achieved.
  • Collaborate with quality, maintenance, and warehouse teams to address equipment issues and ensure preventive maintenance schedules are followed.

Team Leadership and Development

  • Foster a positive and collaborative work environment that prioritizes safety and continuous improvement.
  • Coach, mentor, and train team members to develop their skills and knowledge.
  • Provide constructive feedback and performance evaluations to support individual and team growth.
  • Empower team members to identify and implement process improvements, fostering a culture of ownership.

Quality and Compliance

  • Ensure strict adherence to all safety regulations and procedures, leading by example and conducting safety, quality, and training audits.
  • Maintain accurate production records and reports.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree in engineering, food/fermentation science, chemistry, microbiology, or a related field is strongly preferred, or a minimum of 2 years of supervisory experience in beverage manufacturing.
  • Proven experience leading and motivating a team in a fast-paced manufacturing setting.
  • Strong understanding of production processes and quality control principles in the beverage industry.
  • Excellent communication, interpersonal, and problem-solving skills.
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a demanding environment.
  • Strong sense of urgency and commitment to meeting deadlines.
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite.
